item.title: Inside a Union’s Fight Against Trump’s Federal Job Cuts
item.description: Leaders of the union representing government workers say their battle is galvanizing but also alarming. “It’s insulting to say,” one said, “that we are lazy.”
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Davis O’Brien

item.title: The Business Playbook for Tariff Chaos
item.description: President Trump’s trade war is forcing companies to cut costs, raise prices, shrink profits, discontinue products and find other suppliers.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: Peter Navarro: The Architect of Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Once sidelined, President Trump’s counselor Peter Navarro has returned to Washington and quickly upended the global trading system.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: The Trump Billionaires Who Run the Economy and the Things They Say
item.description: “You have to laugh to keep from crying,” one Republican pollster said about recent comments by the billionaires on the stock market, retirement funds and Social Security.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Bumiller

item.title: Trump Shifted on Tariffs After Bond Holders Got Jittery. He Held Millions Himself.
item.description: As of August, the president’s investment portfolio showed significantly more in bonds than in stocks. It is unclear if his personal holdings had any bearing on his decisions regarding tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Ben Protess, Andrea Fuller and Joe Rennison

item.title: Meloni and Trump Oval Office Meeting Cements Special Rapport
item.description: In Washington, President Trump lavished praise on Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni of Italy. He also accepted her invitation to visit Rome.
item.dc:creator: Emma Bubola

item.title: Did Trump Manipulate the Stock Market?
item.description: President Trump’s post on social media caused the stock market to respond in an unusual way. Rob Copeland, a finance reporter for The New York Times, explains whether this could be considered market manipulation by the president.
item.dc:creator: Rob Copeland, Melanie Bencosme, Alexandra Ostasiewicz and James Surdam

item.title: Trump Says Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s ‘Termination Cannot Come Fast Enough’
item.description: Jerome Powell has said that the Federal Reserve can be patient as the effects of tariffs become more clear. President Trump, pushing for interest rate cuts, said, “Powell’s termination cannot come fast enough!”
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith and Tony Romm

item.title: IMF Warns Trump Tariffs Will Weaken Economy and Increase Inflation
item.description: Kristalina Georgieva, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, warned in a speech that protectionism erodes productivity.
item.dc:creator: Alan Rappeport

item.title: Trump Joins Japan Trade Talks, Says ‘Big Progress’ Made
item.description: For his first face-to-face talks on tariffs, the president chose Japan, a U.S. ally that decades ago stirred his anger over the unequal balance of trade and his penchant for tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Martin Fackler

item.title: Powell Warns Trump Tariffs Could Trigger Higher Inflation and Slower Growth
item.description: Jerome H. Powell warned that President Trump’s tariffs could lead to a “challenging scenario” for the central bank.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Unions Form Pro Bono Legal Network for Federal Workers Targeted by Trump
item.description: Organized labor has taken a leading role in challenging the Trump administration’s downsizing agenda in court. A new service will offer more individualized representation.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Davis O’Brien

item.title: Trump’s 10% Tariff May Be Less Onerous but Still Raises Prices and Threatens Trade
item.description: The blanket tariffs, once considered extreme, still threaten to harm world trade and make everything more expensive for businesses and consumers.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Cohen

item.title: The Grand Egyptian Museum Is Finally Open. (Well, Mostly.)
item.description: The Grand Egyptian Museum, outside Cairo, has been delayed by revolutions, wars, financial crises and a pandemic. At long last, here’s a look inside.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Hiltner

item.title: Trump’s Dilemma: A Trade War That Threatens Every Other Negotiation With China
item.description: President Trump is staking everything on winning by imposing tariffs on China. But the fight threatens to choke off negotiations about other issues like Taiwan, fentanyl, TikTok and more.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger

item.title: Republicans Debate Higher Taxes on the Rich
item.description: The idea of raising taxes on rich Americans has caught the Republican Party between its populist ambitions and low-tax instincts.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Duehren

item.title: Trump Moves to Put New Tariffs on Computer Chips and Drugs
item.description: Citing a national security statute, the administration has begun a process to investigate the impact of imported semiconductors and pharmaceuticals.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson and Tony Romm

item.title: A Devastating Trade Spat With China Shows Few Signs of Abating
item.description: The Trump administration is in a standoff with the Chinese government as trade tensions escalate, leaving U.S. businesses in the cross hairs
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson and Ben Casselman

item.title: Bessent Takes Tricky Center Stage as Trade Wars Roil U.S. Economy
item.description: The Treasury secretary received counsel and criticism from some of his predecessors over President Trump’s policies.
item.dc:creator: Alan Rappeport

item.title: As Tariffs Hit, Americans Are Racing to Buy Car Seats, iPhones and Christmas Gifts
item.description: Many Americans have purchased foreign-made products out of fears that companies could start to raise prices soon.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Ngo
